titleStmt.title: The malignants conventicle: or, A learned speech spoken by M. VVeb, a citizen, to the rest of his society, which did consist of [brace] citizen, malignants, papists, [double brace] priests, apprentices, wenches. At their common tavern meeting-house in Lincolnes Inne-fields. In which are many things very necessary to be observed, and of so great concernment, that if you will not believe, then take what followes: for now all is out.
titleStmt.author: Web, M.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Anti-Dam-mee, in Tell-troth Lane, at this signe of the Holly-wand.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: Tell-troth Lane, at this signe of the Holly-wand.
